content.question: Based on the layers in the diagram, which of the following best explains why a thermal inversion tends to concentrate pollutants in the air layer closest to the Earth’s surface?

choices.label: The air layer that is the second closest to the Earth’s surface is less dense than the layer above it.
The inversion layer is warmer than the air layer that is farthest from the Earth’s surface.
The air layer closest to the Earth’s surface is denser than the layer above it.
The air layer that is farthest from the Earth’s surface contains the coolest air.

content.answer: The air layer closest to the Earth’s surface is denser than the layer above it.
